topics.body:
Oh, and I can't forget about my AP Psych teacher. He was teaching us conditioning, and to demonstrate, he got a trashbag, cut a hole in it, and put it over some kid. He then pulled out a list of seemingly random words. Whenever one of those words was "can", the kid would be blasted in the face with a huge nerf water gun. Eventually, the kid would obviously flinch when the word can was read. When the word can was read and he wasn't blasted, though, the flinching stopped (extinction).  When they were blasted when can was read again, they acquired flinching much faster than their first time around.

Psychology, man.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

Same. 
Although considering I started homeschooling in middle school because I was having emotional breakdowns every other day I can only imagine what my highschool experience would have been like. Like, I've always felt that I'm too greedy and too prideful to commit suicide but if a bad high school experience mixed with how emotionally unstable I was at the time who knows what would have happened. 

I'm in the clear now though in case that worried anyone.
